result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: June 3, 2014. Transcript maintained file 13CF1279.

Defendant Derek R Dercola in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Ted S Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dismissed and Read-in to: 13CF1279 and 13CF1490.  Cash bail is transferred to 13CF1279.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Derek R Dercola
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188   (Effective: 05-09-2014)
Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waujkesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

COURT INCREASES CASH BAIL AN ADDITIONAL $1000.  DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $2500 AND IS TO BE APPLIED.
Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant to have no contact with any Pick n Save store.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program defendant to report the first business day after his release.

Defendant Derek R Dercola in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Erik J Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Based on the defendant's non compliance with WCS, the court increases cash bail an additional $1,000.  Attorney Wolff requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing on May 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
filed by Attorney Peter Wolff.
Demand for Jury filed by Attorney Peter Wolff.

Defendant Derek R Dercola in court with attorney Chelsa Williamson for Atty. Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant went to Rogers Memorial and had been recommended to outpatient. Court orders Atty. Williamson to call WCS to confirm that he reported yesterday and the results of the screening. Case recalled, same appearances. WCS stated defendant did report yesterday, both tests were tampered with and should report at a later date. Court does not take any other action as to bail at this time, he must report to every appointment.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Derek R Dercola in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. State requests modification of bail and presents statements as to non compliance of WCS report. Statements presented by Atty. Wolff. Court orders defendant to report to WCS immediately after hearing to be tested today and provide information on his insurance provider tomorrow at court.
  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on April 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Peter M. Wolff in court.   Defendant Derek R Dercola did not appear.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in an inpatient treatment facility.  Atty Wolff requests a new date.  State has no objection.  Court will grant adjournment.     Preliminary time limits waived.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.
